Moneycontrol Bureau
Shares of Apollo Tyres gained another 3.2 percent intraday Tuesday, in addition to 1.7 percent upside in previous session after acquisition of Germany-based tyre company.
On Monday, it said wholly owned subsidiary would acquire Reifencom GmbH for 45.6 million euro in all cash deal and this deal is likely to be completed in 1-3 months.
Reifencom has turnover of 147 million euro in 2014 and has presence in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France & Denmark.
Additionally, Sunrays Properties & Investment Company, one of the company's promoters, has released pledge on its 33.82 lakh shares on November 10.
Sunrays has 7.02 percent (3.57 crore shares) shareholding in the company as of today, out of which 2.35 percent (1.19 crore shares) stake has been pledged with Bajaj Finance after release of shares.
At 13:40 hours IST, the scrip of Apollo Tyres was quoting at Rs 161.50, up Rs 3.80, or 2.41 percent on the BSE.
Posted by Sunil Shankar Matkar

Apollo Tyres gains 3%, to buy German co for euro 45.6 mn
Reifencom has turnover of 147 million euro in 2014 and has presence in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France & Denmark.
Post your opinion here
 
Moneycontrol Bureau
Shares of Apollo Tyres climbed 3.4 percent intraday Monday as India's second-largest tyre manufacturer will buy German-based tyre retail and distribution company.
The company said its wholly owned subsidiary will acquire Reifencom GmbH for 45.6 million euro in all cash deal, adding this deal is likely to be completed in 1-3 months.
Reifencom has turnover of 147 million euro in 2014 and has presence in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France & Denmark.
"Acquisition will enable Apollo to improve its mix of distribution channels in Germany & Europe and aid in increasing visibility of Apollo and Vredestein tyres in the offline and especially the fast growing online retail space," Neeraj Kanwar, vice chairman and managing director said.
Meanwhile, Apollo Tyres' July-September quarter consolidated profit increased 8.06 percent year-on-year to Rs 278.74 crore but revenue declined to Rs 2,979.98 crore in Q2FY16 from Rs 3,331.41 crore in same period of previous fiscal. Delayed onset of winters in Europe, resulted in lesser than expected sales and pre-orders for winter tyres, adversely impacted company's European operations.
At 12:37 hours IST, the scrip of Apollo Tyres was quoting at Rs 159.20, up Rs 4.10, or 2.64 percent on the BSE.
Posted by Sunil Shankar Matkar
title: Apollo Tyres gains 3%, to buy German co for euro 45.6 mn
